snippet.textDisplay:
I haven't played this game. Neither Shadow of The Colossus.

But when i heard this tune... it took me back. Don't know where or when but its just hit me. A weird sensation.
snippet.textOriginal:
I haven't played this game. Neither Shadow of The Colossus.

But when i heard this tune... it took me back. Don't know where or when but its just hit me. A weird sensation.

snippet.textDisplay:
The tune has an air of mystery, wonder, and genuine safety

It contrasts the situation Ico is in, a mysterious fortress, serious danger, and the implications of escape or death

The couch is a safe haven and should be seen as such, the tune helps players really connect the idea of safety and relaxation. In a game that has you constantly struggling to solve puzzles and keep the girl safe, the music was a work of genius
snippet.textOriginal:
The tune has an air of mystery, wonder, and genuine safety

It contrasts the situation Ico is in, a mysterious fortress, serious danger, and the implications of escape or death

The couch is a safe haven and should be seen as such, the tune helps players really connect the idea of safety and relaxation. In a game that has you constantly struggling to solve puzzles and keep the girl safe, the music was a work of genius

snippet.textDisplay: I can't precisely say why, but this little music is one of the most remarkable things in this so wonderful game.. it always took me hours to save, because of it! ^ ^ so peaceful, relaxing.. or just magical :)

Wow, this sounds similar to Aphex Twin's "Z Twig"

snippet.textOriginal:
Wow, this sounds similar to Aphex Twin's "Z Twig"
Same "in the air" feeling... amazing.

snippet.textDisplay: This game is one of the most beautiful works of art I have ever played, and this music greatly contributes to that experience. Amid the assaulting shadows and perilous parapets, it's just wonderful to sit on that stone sofa and let the soothing music wash over you...
snippet.textOriginal: This game is one of the most beautiful works of art I have ever played, and this music greatly contributes to that experience. Amid the assaulting shadows and perilous parapets, it's just wonderful to sit on that stone sofa and let the soothing music wash over you...

snippet.textDisplay: I know this and SotC were re-released, but I remember picking this one up the 1st week it came out on the PS2. Just the screenshots bring back a flood of memories from this game. An incredible experience, this one. Thanks, SupraDarky.
